subject: Politics
title: International Criminal Court
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: International Criminal Court.

hook.text: The ICC was created to prosecute the world's worst leaders. So far, most targets have been African. Justice or bias?

buildup.text: The ICC prosecutes genocide, war crimes, and crimes against humanity when national courts fail to act.

discovery.text: The ICC issued an arrest warrant for Putin over Ukraine. Enforcement depends on cooperation from member states.

twist.text: The US, China, and Russia refuse to join the ICC. The most powerful nations are beyond its reach.

climax.text: The ICC faces a credibility crisis. Without power over major nations, it risks becoming justice only for the weak.

punchline.text: The ICC aims for global justice. Power keeps it from reaching the most powerful.

quiz.question: Which major nations refuse to join the ICC?
options: The United States, China, and Russia
France, Germany, and the United Kingdom
